This property verifies that the wbuf_used_r signal retains its value when both push and pop are asserted simultaneously. 

Specifically, on every positive edge of the i_clk clock, if both push and pop signals are high, then in the very next clock cycle the value of wbuf_used_r must equal its previous value from the current cycle. The property uses the $past function to reference the previous value of wbuf_used_r.

The assertion triggers whenever push and pop are both active, and checks that wbuf_used_r remains unchanged in the subsequent cycle.

* **Edge/Change Detection & Built-in Functions:**

* **Sequence B (Response/Consequent):**

    * Timing: 1 cycle(s)

* **Temporal Operators Used:**

## Step 4: Property Assembly

* **Implication Type:**
    * Overlapping (`|->`) - consequent evaluation starts in the same cycle as antecedent match

* **Disable Condition:**
    * None specified - property always active

* **Assertion Structure:**
    * `@(posedge i_clk) (push == 1 && pop == 1) |-> ##1 (wbuf_used_r == $past(wbuf_used_r))`

## Step 5: Final SVA Code

```systemverilog
property p_wbuf_used_r_retention;
    @(posedge i_clk)
        (push == 1 && pop == 1) |-> ##1 (wbuf_used_r == $past(wbuf_used_r));
endproperty
assert_p_wbuf_used_r_retention: assert property (p_wbuf_used_r_retention) else $error("Assertion failed: wbuf_used_r does not retain its value when both push and pop are asserted.");
```
